net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal

Class OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.OFSwitchHandshakeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal.OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.OFSwitchHandshakeState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.InitState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.MasterState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.QuarantineState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.SlaveState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitAppHandshakeState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitConfigReplyState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitDescriptionStatReplyState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitInitialRoleState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitPortDescStatsReplyState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitSwitchDriverSubHandshakeState, OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.WaitTableFeaturesReplyState
    Enclosing class:
    OFSwitchHandshakeHandler

    public abstract class OFSwitchHandshakeHandler.OFSwitchHandshakeState
extends java.lang.Object
    Default implementation for message handlers in any state. Individual states must override these if they want a behavior that differs from the default. In general, these handlers simply ignore the message and do nothing. There are some exceptions though, since some messages really are handled the same way in every state (e.g., ECHO_REQUST) or that are only valid in a single state (e.g., HELLO, GET_CONFIG_REPLY

      • illegalMessageReceived

        protected void illegalMessageReceived(OFMessage m)
        We have an OFMessage we didn't expect given the current state and we want to treat this as an error. We currently throw an exception that will terminate the connection However, we could be more forgiving
        Parameters:
        h - the channel handler that received the message
        m - the message
        Throws:
        SwitchStateExeption - we always through the execption

      • extractNiciraRoleReply

        protected OFControllerRole extractNiciraRoleReply(OFMessage vendorMessage)
        Extract the role from an OFVendor message. Extract the role from an OFVendor message if the message is a Nicira role reply. Otherwise return null.
        Parameters:
        h - The channel handler receiving the message
        vendorMessage - The vendor message to parse.
        Returns:
        The role in the message if the message is a Nicira role reply, null otherwise.

      • handlePortStatusMessage

        protected void handlePortStatusMessage(OFPortStatus m,
                           boolean doNotify)
        Handle a port status message. Handle a port status message by updating the port maps in the IOFSwitch instance and notifying Controller about the change so it can dispatch a switch update.
        Parameters:
        h - The OFChannelHhandler that received the message
        m - The PortStatus message we received
        doNotify - if true switch port changed events will be dispatched

      • handleTableFeaturesMessage

                              boolean doNotify)
        Handle a table features message. Handle a table features message by updating the tables in the IOFSwitch instance and notifying Controller about the change so it can dispatch a switch update.
        Parameters:
        h - The OFChannelHandler that received the message
        m - The OFTableFeatures message we received
        doNotify - if true switch table changed events will be dispatched
